text: Private enterprise under the free-market system requires the existence of four conditions. Which option is not among these conditions?
explanation:
Private enterprise under the free-market system requires the existence of four
conditions:

• Freedom of choice - employees can work where they choose, consumers can buy what they want, and firms can hire people and produce what they choose.
• Profits - owners can keep the profits for themselves as rewards for taking risks.
• Fair competition - free and fair competition is the basis for a free-market system to operate efficiently.

explanation:

text:
A firm should offer products that have certain level of quality, at reasonable prices along with good customer service compared to its competitors’ products and customer service. Firms should also establish close relationships with their suppliers. Firms need to be able to compete effectively and to distinguish themselves from their competitors to drive enough revenues for their survival and to prosper.
Which of the following external environments is linked with the statement given above?
explanation:
Every firm operates within a particular market environment in which revenues are obtained. In the market environment, companies interact with customers, employees, suppliers and competitors. Customers expect to receive value from a firm’s products. This means that a firm should offer products that have certain level of quality, at reasonable prices along with good customer service compared to its competitors’ products and customer service. Companies should establish close relationships with their suppliers because product quality, price and timeliness of delivery depend on material resources provided by suppliers.
Employees are very important in helping firms to become more effective. Frontline workers (those who have direct contacts with customers such as salespeople) should be given responsibility, authority, and freedom to do their jobs in order to quickly meet customers’ needs and expectations, i.e. to empower employees. In the market environment, firms need to be able to compete effectively and to distinguish themselves from their competitors to drive enough revenues for their survival and to prosper.
The correct answer is C.

text:
It rises during economic downturns as businesses cut back their workforce. It declines during periods of economic growth when firms begin to hire again.

explanation:

The correct answer is A.

text: Which of the following information about small businesses is <u>not</u> correct?

options.A: A small business is independently owned and operated and not dominant in its field of operation.
options.B: We can measure the size of a small business according to the number of employees or its monetary value.
options.C: Small business flexibility tends to favor innovations in terms of new products or introducing new business processes or methods.
options.D: Small businesses provide goods and services to other small and large companies.
options.E: Small businesses constitute only a small proportion of all enterprises in most countries.

explanation:
Small businesses are very important to most economies, even in advanced economies like the U.S. and the U.K. For example, 99.7% of the U.S. firms are considered to be small businesses in 2012 (less than 500 employees). In Turkey, 99.8% of all enterprises in Turkey are made up of SMEs or those with less than 250 employees which employ more than 73% of the workforce. Thus, small businesses constitute the majority of all enterprises in most economies.
The correct answer is E.

text: Which of the following is an element of a business plan?
explanation:
Elements of a business plan:
  1. INTRODUCTION: Basic information such as the name, address, dates including a title page.
  2. EXECUTIVE SUMMARY: Overview of the entire plan including the technical, marketing, financial, and managerial details. This section is important in that it should convince the investors that the new venture is a worthy investment.
  3. COMPANY DESCRIPTION: Highlights the entrepreneur’s dream, vision, and goals including the industry and legal status of the new venture.
  4. PRODUCT/SERVICE: Details of the products or services, benefits, competitive advantage, and price.
  5. MARKETING PLAN: Details of the industry, competitors, and target market including results from market research.
  6. OPERATING PLAN: Details of daily operation of the business including the location, machines, equipment, people, and processes including suppliers.
  7. MANAGEMENT AND ORGANIZATION: Roles and responsibilities of the people.
  8. FINANCING: Expenses involved (including startup and ongoing expenses) and capital needed.
B is the correct answer.

text: Which of the following is true about the concept of human resource management?

options.C: There is only one and the best way for managing human resources.
options.D: Organisations operate in a changing environment.
options.E: Managers do not need to consistently observe the business environment for opportunities and threats.

explanation: Dealing with human resource issues is not the only the HR department’s responsibility. On the contrary, all managers are, in a sense, human resource managers because they all get involved in recruiting, interviewing, selecting, and training their employees. The success of any HRM program requires the cooperation of managers at different levels who must interpret and implement HRM policies and procedures. Without managerial support, HRM programs cannot succeed. Therefore, human resource managers need to understand clearly how to communicate their policies and procedures to other units of the organisation. There is not only one and the best way for managing human resources. Based on size, sector, employee numbers, financial situation, employee skills and location, each company develops its own HRM program. Organisations operate in a changing environment. Managers need to consistently observe the business environment for opportunities and threats affecting human resources and be prepared to react quickly to these challenges. The environmental factors influencing organisations and human resource management can be described in two main categories. They are internal environmental factors and external environmental factors. text: In which of the following is the human resource planning process ordered correctly?

text:

  4. Replacement chart
Which of the above are among the most commonly used techniques for forecasting human resources supply?
explanation: The two most commonly used techniques for forecasting human resources supply are the replacement chart and skills inventories. The replacement chart lists each important managerial position, who occupies it, how long that person will likely stay in the job, and who is qualified as a replacement. A skills inventory (human resource information system) is a computerized databank containing information on the education, skills, and experience of all present employees. The correct answer is E.

text: Which of the following assesses the effectiveness of the employee’s performance using specific examples of good or bad behaviors at work, often referred to as critical incidents?

text: What is the normal working time in a week, noted in the Turkish Labor Law No.4857?

Total overtime work cannot be more than 270 hours in a year. The correct answer is Choice E.

text: Which of the following is the first step in the hiring process?
explanation: Once the firm has determined its human resources needs via human resource planning, it needs to hire the most qualified employees to fill the available positions. text: In order to talk about a useful segmentation, which one is NOT appropriate?

options.A: People in the same group should be homogenous.
options.B: Some data should be available for each segment.
options.C: The segments should be substantial only in terms of number (sales potential).
options.D: People in different groups should be heterogeneous.
options.E: The segments should also be accessible.

explanation:
In order to talk about a useful segmentation, the following conditions must be met:
  1. People in the same group should be homogenous, i.e. similar to each other in one way of another. This is in fact the basis of effective segmentation: each segment must be similar in terms of needs or chosen characteristics.
  2. People in different groups should be heterogeneous. Together with the first point, this would demonstrate that consumers are effectively divided into sets of differentneeds.
  3. Some data should be available for each segment so that measurements can be made as regards to the size of the market, the general characteristics of consumers constituting that market, details of their buying behavior, and thus, the overall attractiveness of the segment.
  4. The segments should be substantial either in terms of number (sales potential) or in terms profit per unit sold (profit potential). Each company is likely to have a “minimum” requirement to be profitable.
  5. The segments should also be accessible so that an effective distribution and communication strategy can be established.

explanation: The simplest method is called cost-based pricing where companies first figure out the cost of producing one item, and then add a profit margin to arrive the price to be used in the marketplace.

text: Which of the following is not one of the characteristics of the effectiveness of management information?
explanation:
The effectiveness of management information depends on four characteristics:
1. Quality: The information must be accurate and reliable. If not, the solution of the problems will generate new problems.
2. Completeness: The information must be enough to allow the decision maker to make the right decision but not so much as to confuse the issue. Today, having excessive information rather than too little is a significant problem for business managers.
3. Timeliness: Managers can reach the information rapidly and on time. E-mail, instant messaging, and other social media tools make it possible for companies to hear about a problem immediately.
4. Relevance: Every decision maker needs a different variety of information. However, the problem is to have too much data by information systems. ecision makers must be careful about the questions they ask to get the answers they need.

text: Which of the following are external users of accounting information?
explanation: Internal users of accounting information are managers who plan, organize, and run a business. text:
1. Financial accounting and managerial accounting have the same goals.

  3. Managerial accounting uses both financial accounting and estimated data to aid management in running day-to-day operations and in planning future operations.
    Which of the statements above is/are true about financial and managerial accounting?
explanation: Financial accounting and managerial accounting have different goals. Financial accounting focuses on reporting to external parties such as stockholders, investors, governmental agencies, creditors, banks, and suppliers. Financial accounting measures and records business transactions and provides financial statements that are based on generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP). Managerial accounting is concerned with providing information to internal decision makers, such as company managers. Managerial accounting uses both financial accounting and estimated data to aid management in running day-to-day operations and in planning future operations. The correct answer is Choice C.

text: Which of the following is true about managerial accounting?

options.A: It emphasizes financial consequences of past activities.
options.C: It must follow GAAP and be certified by external, independent auditors.
options.D: It emphasizes detailed segment reports about departments, products, and customers.

explanation: In financial accounting the focus and emphasis are on the past; thus, it is past-oriented. It emphasizes financial consequences of past activities. However, managerial accounting is future-oriented. It emphasizes decisions affecting the future. Financial accounting emphasizes precision and managerial accounting the timelines. Financial accounting must follow GAAP and be certified by external, independent auditors. Managerial accounting, on the other hand, does not need to follow GAAP but are based on cost-benefit analysis. Financial accounting emphasizes summary data concerning the entire organization. Managerial accounting emphasizes detailed segment reports about departments, products, and customers. Fianacial accounting emphasizes objectivity and verifiability. Managerial accounting emphasizes relevance. The correct answer is Choice D.

text: Which of the following sets financial reporting requirements for entities under its purview?

options.A: The Union of Chambers of Certified Public Accountants
options.E: The Banking Regulation and Supervision Agency

explanation: The Union of Chambers of Certified Public Accountants of Turkey (TÜRMOB) is the national umbrella organization for the 81 local chambers of CPAs (SMMMs) and Chambers of Sworn-in CPAs (YMMs). e Union is empowered to award professional licenses that Turkey’s accountants must have to render professional services. The Law defines accounting and auditing as a profession and recognizes two qualifications of accounting and auditing professionals granted by the Union of Chambers of Certified Public Accountants (TÜRMOB): Certified Public Accountant (CPA, Serbest Muhasebeci Mali Müşavirler-SMMM) and Sworn- in Certified Public Accountant (Sworn-in CPAs, Yeminli Mali Müşavirler-YMM). text: Which of the following is the first step of accounting cycle?
explanation:
The accounting process starts with identifying and analyzing business transactions
andevents. Transactions can include the sale of a product or the purchase of supplies, equipment, land, etc for business activities that impact the financial position of company. e transaction is recorded chronologically in the journal. All
the transactions are recorded through journal entries. e third step is to post each journal entry to the appropriate ledger accounts. The journalized transactions are posted to the account that it impacts. e accounting cycle requires summarizing of the entries pertaining to a particular period in a trial balance. A trial balance is essentially a list of all accounts and provides an overview of the various types of financial transactions entered into by any organization during a period. After preparation of trial balance, the next step is recording the adjustments like adjusting prepaid/outstanding expenses, recording advance/accrued income, etc. e purpose of adjusting entries is to match incomes with expense during the accounting period. One of the most important steps of the accounting process involve preparing the financial statements. Final step of the accounting process involves closing the books for the revenue and expense accounts which leads to begin again the entire cycle with zero balances. The correct answer is Choice A.

text: Which one of the following is not among the four main sections of Capital Markets Board of Turkey’s Corporate Governance Principles?
explanation: Capital Markets Board of Turkey’s Corporate Governance Principles consist of four main sections, namely shareholders, disclosure and transparency, stakeholders and board of directors

text: The efficient use of resources to create competitive advantage in the market by developing effective and cost efficient systems and processes is the focus of which decision field of business finance?
explanation: Operating decisions focus on the efficient use of resources to create competitive advantage in the market by developing effective and cost efficient systems and processes such as production, service, information, and technology. Businesses need to manage the cash flows and financing needs which arise from daily operations. Operating decisions mainly affect the revenues, costs, and profits of the company.

text: Which of the following is true regarding internal funds?

options.B: They are provided by borrowing from financial institutions.
options.C: They are provided by issuing bonds.

explanation: Internal funds are generated by retaining those profits which are not distributed as dividends to the shareholders. These types of funds provide financing sources for the company to be reinvested in the business for growth. The retained earnings of the company become a part of equity and they provide equity financing.

text: Markets where long-term securities like bonds and stocks are traded are called:
explanation: Financial markets can be classified as: Money markets - markets where short-term securities like commercial paper and treasury bills are traded and Capital markets - markets where long-term securities like bonds and stocks are traded.

text: Forecasted assets and total financing provided by debt and equity financing at a future date are displayed at:
explanation: Companies need to plan for the future to predict futurefinancing requirements and prepare for future needs. Proforma financial statements (mainly balance sheet and income statement) are prepared for this purpose. Pro forma income statement exhibits forecasted revenues and expenses for a future period. Pro forma balance sheet displays forecasted assets and total financing provided by debt and equity financing at a future date.

text: Which of the following is not one of the 5 C’s of credit?
explanation: Banks usually assess the credit worthiness of companies to establish a credit relationship with companies by in view of 5 C’s of credit. These are: character, capacity, capital, collateral and conditions.

text: The risk that a company or individual will not be able to pay the contractual interest or principal on its debt obligations is called:
explanation: Credit risk (Default risk) is the risk that a company or individual will not be able to pay the contractual interest or principal on its debt obligations.

text: Which of the following is true regarding capital investment decisions?

options.A: They involve a lower level of risk compared to short-term investments.
options.B: Activities of planning and evaluating investment projects are called internal control.
options.C: If the present value of future cash flows is lower than the initial outlay, it means that the project will generate some net worth.
options.D: Fixed assets are assets which can be turned into cash in less than a year.
options.E: Capital budgeting process involves economic analysis and selection of projects according to some criteria determined by the company.

explanation: Activities of planning and evaluating investment projects is called capital budgeting. The capital budgeting process involves economic analysis and selection of projects according to some criteria determined by the management of the company.

text: The integrated risk management approach, which considers risks in the context of business strategy and manages them with a portfolio perspective through well defined risk responsibilities and strong risk monitoring processes is called:
explanation: Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) approach has emerged to provide the means to recognize and mitigate risks with a holistic approach. Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) is an integrated risk management approach, which considers risks in the context of business strategy and manages them with a portfolio perspective through well-defined risk responsibilities and strong risk monitoring processes. In ERM, there is a senior level position usually called Chief Risk Officer (CRO) who has the highest responsibility for overseeing the centralized risk management function.

text: Which of the following is false regarding cash flow return on investment (CFROI) methodology?

options.A: More cash is preferred to less.
options.E: CFROI = Cash Flow / Market Value of Capital Employed

explanation: CFROI metric is rooted on the discounted cash flow valuation. Thus: more cash is preferred to less, cash has a time value, sooner is preferred to late, less uncertainty is better. The following formula is used to calculate CFROI:CFROI = Cash Flow / Market Value of Capital Employed.

text: Which of the following is the process of making sound investment choices in line with business strategies and economic analysis?
explanation:
Business finance decisions are related to the resources of a business and they can be grouped as investment decisions, financing decisions and operating decisions.
• Investment decisions
Making sound investment choices in line with business strategies and economic analysis.
• Financing decisions
Selecting the optimum mix of internal and external funds to finance the investments of the business.
• Operating decisions
Employing the resources of the business to efficiently generate profits.

text:
"Investment decisions mainly include decisions related to _________, which can be converted into cash in a relatively short period, namely within one year"
Which of the following can be used to complete the sentence above?
explanation: Investment decisions mainly include decisions related to current assets, which can be converted into cash in a relatively short period, namely within one year; fixed assets, which can be converted into cash in a longer time of period, that is to say, in more than a year. In fact current assets are more liquid assets.

text: Which of the following factors does not affect debt and equity financing?

options.C: Level of control that management seeks to maintain
options.D: Costs of debt financing and equity financing

explanation:
The best mix of debt financing and equity financing depends on the type of the industry in which the company operates and general economic conditions as well. Moreover, it depends on the following factors:
The combination of internal funds and external funds creates the financing structure, in other words the capital structure of the company.
  • Level of risk that management can be assumed in case of unpredicted events.
  • Level of earnings to cover the interest payments associated with debt financing and dividend payments associated with equity financing.
  • Level of control that management seeks
    to maintain as issuing new shares of stock brings new shareholders to the company who have voting rights as owners of the company.
  • Costs of debt financing and equity financ- ing at the time of capital structure decisions.
  • Conditions in the financial markets.

text: Which of the following is the market where short-term securities like commercial paper and treasury bills are traded?
explanation:

  • Secondary markets: Markets in which currently outstanding securities are traded.

text: What is Pro forma balance sheet used for?

options.A: It exhibits forecasted revenues and expenses for a future period.
options.B: It prepares plans to finance the financing requirements that will arise.
options.C: It displays forecasted assets and total financing provided by debt and equity financing at a future date.

I- Assessing the profitability of a single investment project.
II- Assessing the relative profitability of competing investment projects.
III- Selecting the best investment projects in a portfolio of projects with a limited budget.
Which of the above are the main categories of investment decisions?
explanation:
